column1: # The axTLS is a highly configurable Transport Layer Security (TLS) version 1 SSL library for embedded devices

column2: Requirement Specification
The axTLS shall select the OS platform
The OS Platform shall use one and only one of the Linux OS, CygWin OS or Win32 OS
The Win32 OS may use the Win32 crypto library
The Win32 OS shall use the Visual Studio compiler
The Visual Studio compiler shall use one and only one of the compiler version 7.0, compiler version 8.0 or compiler version 10.0
The axTLS may select the debug mode
The axTLS may select the unwanted section stripping
The axTLS shall use the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) library
The SSL library shall select SSL mode
The SSL mode shall use one and only one of the Server Only, the Server Only with Verify, the Server and Client, the Server and Client with Full Diagnostic or the Skeleton mode
The server only with verify mode may select the performance testing
The server and client full diagnostic mode may select the SSL testing
The SSL library shall select SSL protocol
The SSL protocol shall use one and only one of the low security protocol, the medium security protocol or the high security protocol
The SSL library may use default key
The SSL library may select X.509 certificate generation
The SSL library may use Privacy Enhanced Mail (PEM) format
The SSL library may use Public Key Cryptography Standard (PKCS) 12 format
The SSL library may use the SSL context mutex
The SSL library may use the /dev/urandom
The SSL library may select OpenSSL Application Programming Interface (API) compatibility
The axTLS may use the axTLS wrap
The axTLS may use the Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS) Web Server
The HTTPS Web Server may use the static build
The HTTPS Web Server may select the directory listing
The HTTPS Web Server may use the authorization
The HTTPS Web Server may use the IPv6
The HTTPS Web Server may select the different user
The HTTPS Web Server may use the verbose mode
The HTTPS Web Server may select the daemon process
The HTTPS Web Server may use the common gateway interface (CGI)
The common gateway interface (CGI) may use the HTTP library for LUA programming language
The HTTP library for LUA may select the LUA build and installation
The axTLS may select the language bindings
The language bindings may use the C# bindings
The language bindings may use the VB .NET bindings
The language bindings may use the Java bindings
The language bindings may use the Perl bindings
The language bindings may use the LUA bindings
The axTLS may select the axSSL sample generation
The axSSL sample generation may select the C language sample
The axSSL sample generation may select the C# language sample
The axSSL sample generation may select the VB .NET language sample
The axSSL sample generation may select the Jave language sample
The axSSL sample generation may select the Perl language sample
The axSSL sample generation may select the LUA language sample
The axTLS may use the big-integer options
The big-integer options may use the reduction algorithm
The reduction algorithm shall use one and only one of the Classical algorithm, the Montgomery algorithm or the Barrett algorithm
The big-integer options may use the Chinese_Remainder_Theorem (CRT)
The big-integer options may use the Karatsuba multiplication
The big-integer options may use the sliding window exponentiation
The big-integer options may use the square algorithm
The big-integer options may use the big-integer integrity check
The big-integer options shall define the big-integer size
The big-integer size shall select one and only one of the 8-bit integer, the 16-bit integer or the 32-bit integer
The Win32 OS excludes the common gateway interface (CGI)
The Win32 OS excludes the IPv6
The Win32 OS excludes the LUA bindings
The Win32 OS excludes the axTLS wrap
The Win32 OS excludes the daemon process
The Win32 OS excludes the /dev/urandom
The Win32 OS excludes the different user
The skeleton mode excludes the PEM format
The skeleton mode excludes the PKCS12 format
The skeleton mode excludes the big-integer options
The skeleton mode excludes the SSL protocol
The debug mode excludes the unwanted section stripping
The C# language sample requires the C# bindings
The VB .NET language sample requires the VB .NET bindings
The Java language sample requires the Java bindings
The Perl language sample requires the Perl bindings
The LUA language sample requires the LUA bindings
